forecast-period.text: Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height.
Details of warnings are available on the Bureau's website www.bom.gov.au, by telephone 1300-659-217* or through some TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones.
Check the latest forecasts for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for neighbouring marine areas.

An intense low pressure system centred east of Tasmania will move southeast across the Tasman Sea during Saturday. A high pressure system will also move eastwards across the Bight, passing Tasmania on Saturday night and early Sunday. A low pressure trough is then expected to approach western Bass Strait early next week.

area.description: Central Coast: Cape Otway to Wilsons Promontory
area.warning-summary: Strong Wind Warning for Saturday for Central Coast

forecast-period.text: Winds: West to southwesterly 15 to 20 knots tending south to southwesterly 10 to 15 knots by midday. Winds turning south to southeasterly below 10 knots in the evening. Seas: 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing below 1 metre around midday. Weather: Cloudy. 50% chance of showers.

Winds: East to southeasterly 10 to 15 knots tending south to southwesterly in the late afternoon then tending east to southeasterly 15 to 20 knots in the evening. Seas: Below 1 metre. Weather: Mostly sunny.
Winds: Easterly 15 to 20 knots turning south to southeasterly during the afternoon then tending east to southeasterly during the evening. Seas: Around 1 metre. Weather: Sunny.

Winds: Easterly 15 to 20 knots becoming variable about 10 knots during the morning then becoming easterly 10 to 15 knots during the evening. Seas: Around 1 metre, decreasing below 1 metre during the morning. Weather: Sunny.
